intro: Pluchea adnata, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by spherical, dry fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Pluchea adnata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
